columnA.title: Fauda
columnA.techTags: React, JavaScript, HTML, Sass, SVG, Scrollama.js
columnA.description: A historical journey through the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, in partnership with Netflix and their Israeli political thriller TV series. In this React web application, I used JavaScript ES6, Sass, inline SVGs, and Scrollama.js to build an interactive map component and an efficient, performant scrollytelling experience.

columnA.title: To Pledge Allegiance
columnA.techTags: JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, Sass, Web Audio API
columnA.description: An immersive web experience showcasing a selection of audio stories from citizens affected by The Vietnam War, in partnership with PBS and Ken Burns' critically acclaimed documentary series. I built a custom HTML5 audio player and a countdown timer component using JavaScript ES6, jQuery, Sass, and the Web Audio API.

columnA.title: Designing for the Future
columnA.description: An interactive custom content piece exploring the future of design via Volvo's human-centric design philosophy, presented by the XC60, considered its most progressive and future-facing vehicle. I developed a content-responsive scrolling system using JavaScript ES6, CSS/SVG animations, and in-view.js

columnA.client: Bank of America x The Atlantic
columnA.title: Beyond the Bottom Line
columnA.description: An interactive experience exploring how companies are strengthening their business through best practices in environmental, social, and corporate governance (ESG) policies. I built the interactive cards, animations, and a modular modal component system using JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, and CSS.

columnA.client: Stanford Children's Health x The Atlantic
columnA.title: Building with Care
columnA.description: A photo-driven custom content article takes you on a digital tour of the Lucile Packard Children's Hospital from the perspective of several stakeholders, including the chief medical officer, lead architect, and former patients. I built the navigation bar and photo hot spot components from scratch using JavaScript, jQuery, HTML, and CSS.

columnB.title: The Possibility Report
columnB.description: An expansive multimedia hub of articles, infographics, and videos exploring how new technologies will reframe our understanding of the world, in partnership with VMware. I developed a semantic, modular system of reusable components using JavaScript ES6, jQuery, HTML, and Sass (BEM architecture).

columnB.title: How Can Cities Succeed in the 21st Century?
columnB.description: A data-driven look at how WeWork is revolutionizing the future of work and impacting cultural change in the workplace and in cities. I built two interactives from scratch–a data visualization and animated infographic–using JavaScript ES6, Sass, SVG animation, and Slick.js.

columnB.title: Behanced
columnB.techTags: React, JavaScript, HTML, Sass, axios, Behance API
columnB.description: A minimalist Adobe Behance clone built with React, JavaScript ES6, Sass, axios, and the Behance API. I redesigned the cards and developed a navigation bar and dropdown menu component with category filters using the axios library to programmatically fetch and render all relevant API data.

columnB.title: So You Think You Know the Kennedys?
columnB.description: An interactive family tree tells the untold story of the American royal family, in partnership with CNN to support their docuseries, American Dynasties. I implemented a photo-expanding component, modal system, and timeline animation using JavaScript, jQuery, and in-view.js

columnB.title: Investing: Was It Designed to Mystify Everyday Americans?
columnB.description: A full-screen interactive infographic examining the history of the financial industry and how the power of fintech is making investing more accessible. I built this scrolling experience using a “page piling” transition effect using JavaScript, jQuery, and pure HTML/CSS.
